awd_titl_txt: A Study of Cells and Cellular Processes Through the Use of  Immunofluorescence and the Video Camera
awd_abstract_narration: This two-year college emphasizes laboratory based learning and use of           high technology equipment. This project upgrades their ability to               expose students to the principles of biology and the use of laboratory          data to explore these principles. Through the acquisition of a                  fluorescent microscope with phase contrast options, a high resolution           video camera, a video pointer, two TV monitors and a VCR, they can              produce edited videotapes of specimens and ongoing processes that could         otherwise be seen by a limited number of students. The equipment allows         increased use of fluorescent antibody procedures and increased viewing          of microscopic events by students. They can also use the videotapes in          a number of additional courses, and make them available to other                campuses. The institution is contributing 102% of the NSF award.

inst.inst_name: University of South Carolina Lancaster Campus
